notAlone.title: You're Not Alone ğŸ’™
notAlone.content: Puberty is a natural part of growing up. Everyone goes through it at their own pace. This app is here to help you understand what's happening, track your journey, and feel confident about the changes ahead.

changes.title: Understanding Changes
changes.subtitle: Puberty brings many changes to your body and mind. Let's explore them together! ğŸŒŸ

growth.title: Growth Spurts
growth.description: You'll grow taller! This happens at different times for everyone.

bodyShape.title: Body Shape Changes
bodyShape.description: Your body will develop new curves and proportions as you mature.

voice.title: Voice Changes
voice.description: Your voice may deepen or change in pitch - this is totally normal!

skin.title: Skin Changes
skin.description: You might get acne or oily skin. Good hygiene helps manage this.

hair.title: Hair Growth
hair.description: New hair will grow in different places on your body.

odor.title: Body Odor
odor.description: You'll start to sweat more. Using deodorant becomes important!

mood.title: Mood Swings
mood.description: Your emotions might feel like a rollercoaster - that's normal!

interests.title: New Interests
interests.description: You might develop new hobbies, interests, and passions.

independence.title: Independence
independence.description: You'll want more privacy and independence from family.

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description: Friendships and social connections become more important.

awareness.title: Self-Awareness
awareness.description: You'll think more about who you are and who you want to be.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Building confidence takes time - be patient with yourself!

remember.title: Remember: Everyone is Different ğŸŒˆ
remember.timing: Timing: Puberty can start anywhere from ages 8-14. There's no "right" time!
remember.pace: Pace: Some changes happen quickly, others take years. Your journey is unique.
remember.support: Support: Talk to trusted adults if you have questions or concerns. They're here to help!
